intro: Phyllanthus hohenackeri var. johnstonei, commonly known as the Johnstone's phyllanthus, is a rare shrub native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
